moves.1. d4: I start with my Queen Pawn.
moves.1... Nf6: A non-committal move that will transpose into a modern queen pawn defense.
moves.3. d5 g6: Refusing to commit to the Modern Benoni (3...e6), Benko Gambit (3...b5), or Czech Benoni (3...e5).
moves.4. Nc3 a6: 4...a6!? points at the pawn break b7-b5.
moves.5... d6: This Benoni sideline looks like a King's Indian Defense with ...c5.
moves.7... h6: I'm not sure what to think of this move. I would give it a ?!
moves.8... Nbd7 9. Rb1: 19.Rb1!? Since I think ...b5 is coming, I want to play b3 without worrying about tactics based on the a1-h8 diagonal and place my rook on a file that might open.
moves.9... O-O: 9.O-O? This move overlooks my threat the capture the h6-pawn
moves.10. Bxh6: Capturing the loose pawn and forcing a swap of DSB's.
moves.10... Ne5: This natural-looking move might be a mistake because it allows me to play f4 with tempo.
moves.11... Kxg7 12. f4 Neg4: This move is a mistake because it allows me to pawn storm with tempo.
moves.13. h3: The first tempo, supporting the g2-g4 pawn thrust.
moves.13... Nh6 14. g4: Tempo #2: I advance my g-pawn and threaten to fork black's knights.
moves.14... Nh7 15. g5: Tempo #3: advancing another pawn with tempo.
moves.16... e5: This is an attempt to stop my attack, but it is a mistake because I can en passant the pawn.
moves.17. dxe6 e.p. Bxe6: Black recaptures with the bishop. Is 17...fxe6 better?
moves.18. Nd5: Adding my knight to the attack.
moves.18... Bg4: Trying to prevent the opening maneuver h4-h5.
moves.19. Be2: I don't see any other options, so I offer to trade.
moves.19... Bxe2 20. Qxe2: Should I have recaptured with the knight?
moves.20... Ne7: Trying to trade off my more active knight.
moves.22. cxd5: 22.exd5?? would cost me my queen. Now I wish I had castled queenside instead of playing 9.Rb1.
moves.22... Qa5+: Wins the pawn back, but my attack continues.
moves.23. Kf2 Qxa2 24. Nf3: Connecting my rooks and developing my final piece. Although my knight seems misplaced, I don't see any good alternative.
moves.24... c4: This is a very bad move because it allows my knight to join the attack.
moves.25. Nd4: Taking advantage of my opponent's mistake.
moves.25... Rac8: ? Too slow, ignoring my attack. Which move would have allowed black to survive and how could I counter it?
moves.26. hxg6: Opening lines into the enemy position
moves.26... fxg6: This move loses the exchange but is there an alternative? (26...Kxg6 loses to  27.Qh5+ Kg7 28.Qxh7#)
moves.27... Kg8 28. Nxf8 Rxf8 29. Kg3: Not sure what I was thinking. Any suggestions for a better move?
moves.37. Rxa6 Nf8 38. Rxd6 Ke7 39. Rb6 Nd7 40: The knight is lost: 42...Nb6 or 42...Nb8 49. RxN KxN e7, when the pawn promotes, or 42...Nf8 43.e7 and the e-pawn promotes.
Black resigns as he cannot prevent promotion.

gameName: Attacking the enemy king, please give suggestions
